title.narrative: Gender equality in Private Sector Development

description.narrative: Gender training for partners in agriculture/private sector development, as well as partners (financial sector deepening programmes) in financial inclusion. The training aims at strengthening the gender perspective, especially in ongoing contributions. These training efforts are part of Africa's plan for gender mainstreaming, which is based on Sida's overall plan for Gender mainstreaming 2016-2018 and Sweden's result strategy with Tanzania 2013-2019

Jämställdhetsutbildning för partners inom 1) lantbruk/privatsektorutveckling samt även inom 2) inkluderande finansiell utveckling). Utbildningen syftar till att stärka jämställdhetsperspektivet i pågående insatser. Satsningen är en del av AFRIKAs jämställdhetsplan som baseras på Sidas övergripande plan om jämställdhet 2016-2018 och i linje med Sidas resultatstrategi med Tanzania.

The aim of the intervention was to strengthen gender perspectives in the private sector development through gender integration support to strengthen the work and results of the five partners in agricultural value chains in Tanzania. Specific objectives were to provide training and support to the five Sida partners with the aim to introduce three to four smart strategic gender entry-points, to develop gender aims, actions and gender indicators for value chain upgrading from a business perspective. The consultants implemented the assignment using various methods, which included conducting a desk study of relevant materials provided by the partners, Embassy of Sweden and Sida Stockholm; provision of input in to the gender training programme and co-facilitating it; conducting partners needs assessments at organisational and institutional levels; facilitating partners to develop 3 to 4 smart entry points and gender actions plans; and coching where they also assisted partners to finalize their mini gender plans developed during training. During coaching, consultants provided technical assistance, guidance, oral input, materials, and gender analysis and mainstreaming tools to integrate gender perspectives in their organizations at institutional and organizational levels.

participating-org.narrative: PWYC/Portfolio for Women, Youth & Communities Enablement

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the period from 04 September, 2017 to 16 March, 2018 facilitators implemented the five main activities: 1. Conducted a desk review of key documents of Partner's activities2. Provided input to the gender training programme content that was prepared by Embassy of Sweden and Sida;3. Co-facilitated the gender training workshop;4. Provided coaching support to the partners; and5. Facilitated the Learning Workshop At the end of the intervention, the following was acheieved:1. Increased understanding of how gender can be mainstreamed at project level, which includes identification of hands on activities. Sessions on HOW to integrate gender perspectives in operational and institutional level were facilitated through mutual coaching among the Partneron improvements and practical examples during workshop aiming at improving efficiency of projects. As the first step towards improving Partner's gender integration at operational level, participants were provided with guiding questions to identify entry points/actions to improve gender integration using their own project proposals, strategic and business plans - at operational level in proposal design, implementation, gender analysis (to generate sex disaggregated statistics), and description of norms and inclusion of intersectionality. 2. Increased knowledge about organizational-set up needs to have successful gender mainstreaming at project level, as well as identification of hands-on and realistic changes to be made at organizational level during workshop. Facilitators also provided guiding and mechanisms for effective gender mainstreaming/integration. At institutional level, it requires favorable framework policies, systems, practices and strategies; as well as work gender sensitive processes, procedures and guidelines for external gender mainstreaming; as well as building internal gender capacity of staff and gender sensitization, awareness, skills to address gender gaps/issues. 3. Be the start-up of gender mainstreaming support, taking off-set in what partners identify to be of most importance.Facilitators provided Partners with a framework for mainstreaming gender perspectives at institutional level/supportive mechanisms, which consisted of 6 components - i.e. framework, resources, knowledge, system, communication which guided agribusiness partners to identify gender gaps/issues and entry points/actions to improve gender integration in their organizations 4. A deepend assessment of Partners' gender needs that was contributed by the coaching sessions that were part of the programme; a) The coaching sessions provided guidance, which helped partners to finalize and implement their mini gender action plans successfully.b) The sessions also built partners’ confidence that they can integrate gender perspectives in their organizations. At the beginning, some business-oriented partners were not sure if gender perspectives could be integrated in their organizations.c) The coaching sharpened further partners’ knowledge and skills of gender analysis – i.e. situation/context analyses and disaggregating information by sex and age.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
